intro: Hibbertia aurea, commonly known as the golden hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red centers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Hibbertia aurea has narrow, linear leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and long-lasting blooms.
